intro: Centaurium linariifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has slender, branched stems. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
